pkgmetadata.longdescription: This is a really basic metapackage to pull in some stuff which Gentoo doesn't include by default but is generally considered standard on almost every other big distribution of Linux (and most other UNIX derivatives). As of right now, it makes sure you have sudo, one of app-misc/screen or app-misc/tmux, iptables, a cron implementation, a syslog implementation, an mta, bc (this gets pulled in anyway by most kernel sources packages), logrotate, and a vi clone (defaults to vim, because that's what I use. The general idea is that most people install this stuff (except possibly vi) anyway, so it should be easy to just pull it all in at once.
